page.title: 13Two Schools in Frimley
page.content: Frimley Green C of E Middle School was opened in 1868 for 88 children from a wide area, as Frimley Green was not highly populated then. The need to extend, to cater for a much increased population locally, was carefully done during the past year to preserve the elegant appearance of the school. There are now 190 pupils aged 8 to 12 years. Many sports are played and children learn all subjects, including use of the computer at least once a week. Older pupils have one hour's homework each night. Burrow Hill School, set in 2\ acres of beautiful grounds, is for children with problems at home. Most come from Inner London. The 40 pupils live at school and may go home on alternate weekends and for holidays. Many extra activities, like nature trails, are organised for them at weekends.
